# ASAuthorization.Scope

**Structure**

The kinds of contact information that can be requested from the user.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Scope
```

## Discussion

Use one or more of these values in the [doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/documentation/AuthenticationServices/ASAuthorizationOpenIDRequest/requestedScopes] array that you configure in an instance of either [doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/documentation/AuthenticationServices/ASAuthorizationAppleIDRequest] or [doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/documentation/AuthenticationServices/ASAuthorizationSingleSignOnRequest] to request certain contact information from the user.

Inspect the [doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/documentation/AuthenticationServices/ASAuthorizationAppleIDCredential/authorizedScopes] array of an [doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/documentation/AuthenticationServices/ASAuthorizationAppleIDCredential] instance, or the (similarly named) [doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/documentation/AuthenticationServices/ASAuthorizationSingleSignOnCredential/authorizedScopes] array of an [doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/documentation/AuthenticationServices/ASAuthorizationSingleSignOnCredential] instance, to see what scopes the user actually authorized. This might differ from the scopes you requested.

## Scopes

- **email**: A scope that includes the user’s email address.
- **fullName**: A scope that includes the user’s full name.

## Creating a Scope

- **init(_:)**: Creates a scope from the given string.
- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a scope from the given string.

## Setting the Scope

- **requestedScopes**: The contact information to be requested from the user during authentication.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
